tier.item: (1) Tous les étrangers n'ont pas de carte d'identité.
All the foreigners ne-have not (of) card of identity.
a. `It is not the case that all foreigners have an ID'
b. `For all foreigners, it is the case that they don't have an ID' .

tier.item: (2) Aucun des étudiants n'a lu trois livres de cette liste.
None of the students ne-have read three books on this list.
a. `It is not the case that any of the students has read three books
on this list'.
b. `For three books on this list, it is the case that no student has
read them'.

tier.item: d. Il n'est pas allé à Paris pour faire de la figuration
He ne-is not gone to P. to do walk-on parts
7 These verb forms may have a restricted subcategorization, compared with the
positive V. For instance, the verb ne-savoir i s specialized for an interrogative
complement, while savoir negated with pas accepts the same subcategorizations as
savoir.
`He did not go to Paris to do walk-on parts'

complement, while savoir negated with pas accepts the same subcategorizations as
savoir.
